attributes.action: The CUT Campaign against VAT on e-books (CAVE)     -
attributes.additional_details:
CUT - The Writers e-Publishing Community wants the UK Government to abolish VAT on e-books.

visit CUT at; www.cutalongstory.com

We want the UK treasury to begin the process of abolition unilaterally and then lobby the EU to do likewise.

As a nation with such a proud heritage of writing it is simply wrong that we tax reading, by placing VAT on e-books. This was recognised when VAT was introduced 42 years ago and books were zero rated, so why tax e-books, now representing nearly a quarter of all books purchased and forecast to be 50% by the end of this decade.

We must promote reading and by adding VAT to e-books we are smothering our culture under tax.

Here is an example of how unfair it is.

	Version 				Book		e-Book
	Selling Price			£10.00		£10.00
	VAT				          £0.00		  £2.00
	after UK tax			£10.00		  £8.00

So we at CUT - The Writers e-Publishing Community urge you the UK Government to join us in the fight.
